dialogs.text: I barely escaped Charon station, but some part of me remained there.
My dearest daughter was part of a secret government research to create super-humans and it didn’t end well. It never does.
She is now roaming her beloved laboratory turned into a monster. And all I have left is a story that will shake all the planets inhabited by humans to the core.
I don’t care what comes after that, It will be my last piece and I will make every word count.
Visions from Charon still haunt me, but I finished it. It came out today in all the important newspapers. I didn’t take any money for it - I will not need them anymore.
It is only a matter of time before the government will send some men in black to get me and take me somewhere where nobody will find me.
A quick fake trial and lifetime in some mining colony is the best I can hope for.
On the other hand I don’t think it will come to that. I am pretty sure, someone will kill me before that. I uncovered too much.
Maybe I should have stayed on Charon with my daughter and die there. Maybe some secrets are better left uncovered. I hope at least someone will learn from my mistakes.
